name: Waterfall Creek (Mount Wilson)
description:
A pretty canyon, just half-day loop from Cathedral Reserve campground. The canyon was once popular, with seemingly Victorian era steps cut into the rock to avoid one of the pools. Always difficult to know how often a canyon is visited, you'd think this would be infrequent, but 3 separate groups were in the canyon on Sat 3 Feb 2024.

Approach

From Cathedral Reserve campground, walk up to Beowang Rd and follow it to the end, then skirt the final property on the left outside of the private property boundary.

Descent

There are swimming pools, but you can keep to waist deep if you're careful and select the best side of each drop to descend.

Exit

Up steep dirt slopes to the Mt Irvine Road. You may find an old walking track zig-zagging up.

Red tape
